rows.intro_text: Here's a story of a supportive father in child care.
rows.slide_1_text: Ssemakula from Kirowoza village is married with four children. Whenever his wife is pregnant, Mr. Ssemakula accompanies her to the Health Centre and brings her back home.
rows.slide_2_text: The family does not have a lot of money, but they seem happy and healthy. On weekends, the family works together on the farm.
rows.slide_3_text: Whenever the wife delivers, Ssemakula takes turns with her to look after the baby even at night when the child is restless or crying.
rows.slide_4_text: In his compound, Ssemakula plays different games with the older children such as football, hide and seek, and spends time reading with them and teaching them to ride the bicycle.

rows.slide_1_text: Sarah's mother is washing clothes while his younger brother is playing with bricks.
rows.slide_2_text:
Sarah walks toward his brother
 
Sarah humbly: "Give it to me!"
rows.slide_3_text: Sarah's mother shouting: "Please give the bricks back to your brother."
rows.slide_5_text:
Sarah's mother: Sarah, if you cannot place nicely with your brother, I will tell your father.
Sarah's brother continues crying.

rows.slide_1_text: Mother: "Sam, you have been coming home from playing with your friends after sunset."
rows.slide_2_text: Mother: "It is too dangerous in the community after dark. From now on, our household rule is that you need to come home before sunset, okay?"
rows.slide_3_text: Mother: "Thank you, Sam, for coming before sunset. Tomorrow let's go to soccer match together."

rows.slide_1_text: Susan and her husband John have a troublesome son, Henry, who is 11 years old. Henry is very energetic and creative. However, he often gets into trouble at school.
rows.slide_2_text: On weekends and even on some school days, Henry escapes from home to watch video in the trading centre. Susan’s husband often blames her for Henry’s bad behaviour saying that she spends too much time at her job as a charcoal seller in the market, when she should be home more, watching over the children.
rows.slide_3_text: One day Susan and her husband got into a heated argument and he hit her. He often did so but this time, Susan decided that she could not take it anymore. She lashes out at Henry and beats him up, blaming him for always bringing her problems.
rows.slide_4_text: A male neighbour passed but did not say anything. As Susan contemplated leaving, she thought about her children and got discouraged, saying the children would suffer without her.

rows.title: Story Time
rows.slide_1_text: “But I did not do anything wrong, we are just friends” Adome insisted, when a family member voiced concern over the time he was spending with the girl working in the bar and restaurant.
rows.slide_2_text: In Adome’s mind, he had not crossed any lines because there was nothing much that was happening; “I only tap her behind sometimes, just for fun, and I have no problem spending time with someone who cooks and serves us food and beer very well, daily.
rows.slide_3_text: Adome and his wife Dorotia had been happily married for 5 years having had a very powerful ‘kwanjula’. But Dorotia is a quiet and shy person at home. She cannot make a conversation and Adome often feels lonely – even when they are together. Dorotia is a faithful wife and a good mother who is very strict in raising her 2 two children.
rows.slide_4_text: When it comes to being sensitive to his needs (including bedroom affairs), Adome feels that Dorotia has a lot to learn yet, both of them have challenges with body hygiene issues.The restaurant girl, however, is a good listener and easily reads Adome’s moods. She is quick to laugh with him and is fun to be around.
rows.slide_5_text: As the two continued to spend time together, a friend to whom Adome had casually told about the relationship mentioned it to Dorotia. but Adome dismissed her concerns. Dorotia was so disturbed and wanted the matter resolved. So she invited the ‘Ssenga’ for a meeting with them.

rows.title: Story Time
rows.slide_1_text: A mother was bathing a child when the father returned home and asked to be served tea.
rows.slide_2_text: Patiently, she explained that she was still busy bathing the child, and that the other children were also waiting to be bathed.
rows.slide_3_text: She asked the husband to come and bathe the children as she goes to prepare tea for him. The father agreed and took over this responsibility. A few minutes later, the tea was ready.
rows.slide_4_text: A neighbour who was then passing by saw this and was impressed to see a father bathing his child as their mother served tea. He wondered how they were able to share the roles easily.
rows.slide_5_text: The couple told him that they had benefited from attending Parenting for Respectability sessions.

rows.title: Story
rows.slide_1_text: Nakato is a 13 year- old girl in Primary7 in a certain school.
rows.slide_2_text: She tries to work hard but received a very low mark in the mid-year examinations.
rows.slide_3_text: That same day, her parents found out that there is a man in the neighborhood who has been pestering Nakato to have a love relationship with him, and even promised to marry her.
rows.slide_4_text: Just before examinations, Nakato’s teacher had tried to contact the parents regarding her academics, but the parents were busy.
